post.title: Looking for a roommate to share a 2BR/2BA apartment near campus!
post.content: I'm a rising junior at LUC and I'm looking for a roommate to share a 2BR/2BA apartment near campus. The apartment is fully furnished and has a washer and dryer in unit. Rent is $XXXX per month and utilities are split evenly. I'm a clean and tidy person and I'm looking for a roommate who is similar. I'm also social and I enjoy hanging out with my friends, but I also respect personal space. If you're interested in the room, please send me a message with a little bit about yourself.
post.author: Leen

post.title: looking for new event at luc
post.author: Waad

post.title: How to survive your first semester of college
post.content: College can be a lot to handle, especially your first semester. Here are a few tips to help you survive and thrive: Get involved in extracurricular activities. This is a great way to meet new people and make friends. Don't be afraid to ask for help. If you're struggling in a class, don't hesitate to reach out to your professor or TA. Take care of yourself. Make sure you're getting enough sleep, eating healthy foods, and exercising regularly.
post.author: Waad

post.title: The best books to read for your college courses
post.content: Here are a few of the best books to read for your college courses: The Autobiography of Malcolm X by Malcolm X and Alex Haley The Handmaid's Tale by Margaret Atwood Beloved by Toni Morrison 1984 by George Orwell Catch-22 by Joseph Heller
